meanings.sent1: Her constant selfies and self-praise showed her narcissism.
meanings.sent2: His narcissism made it hard for him to see others' needs.
meanings.sent3: At the party, his narcissism led him to talk only about himself.
meanings.sent4: The mirror reflected his narcissism back at him.

meanings.definition: A psychological condition characterized by an inflated sense of self-importance.
meanings.sent1: The celebrity's narcissism made them believe they were above everyone else.
meanings.sent2: His narcissism affected his relationships as he always put himself first.
meanings.sent3: In a funny twist, his narcissism made him think he was the king of the office.
meanings.sent4: The politician's narcissism was a crown that weighed heavily on his head.
meanings.sent5: The dark cloud of his narcissism followed him wherever he went.

meanings.definition: Excessive admiration of or obsession with oneself.
meanings.sent1: Her friends grew tired of her constant narcissism and self-praise.
meanings.sent2: His narcissism made him blind to the needs and feelings of others.
meanings.sent3: In a humorous way, his narcissism made him believe he was the most interesting person in the world.
meanings.sent4: The mirror whispered back his narcissism, amplifying his self-obsession.
meanings.sent5: The bright spotlight of his narcissism overshadowed everything else in his life.
